aria-allowed-role-1.title: Uses ARIA roles on incompatible elements
aria-allowed-role-1.description: Many HTML elements can only be assigned certain ARIA roles. Using ARIA roles where they are not allowed can interfere with the accessibility of the web page. [Learn more about ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-allowed-role).

items.snippet: <input type="checkbox" id="main-menu-input" class="toggle-list__checkbox" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" aria-expanded="false" aria-labelledby="mw-mf-main-menu-button">
items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  ARIA role button is not allowed for given element

aria-valid-attr-value-2.title: `[aria-*]` attributes do not have valid values
aria-valid-attr-value-2.description: Assistive technologies, like screen readers, can't interpret ARIA attributes with invalid values. [Learn more about valid values for ARIA attributes](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-valid-attr-value).

items.snippet: <a id="ca-watch" href="/en/wiki/index.php?title=Special:UserLogin&returnto=United+States+Military…" class="mw-ui-icon mw-ui-icon-element mw-ui-icon-wikimedia-star-base20 mw-ui-icon-…" data-mw="interface" data-event-name="menu.watch" role="button" aria-controls="mw-watchlink-notification">
items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  Invalid ARIA attribute value: aria-controls="mw-watchlink-notification"

color-contrast-3.title: Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.
color-contrast-3.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn how to provide sufficient color contrast](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/color-contrast).

items.snippet: <a id="" href="" class="mw-ui-icon mw-ui-icon-element mw-ui-icon-wikimedia-language-base20 mw-ui-b…" data-mw="interface" data-event-name="menu.languages" role="button">

definition-list-4.title: `<dl>`'s do not contain only properly-ordered `<dt>` and `<dd>` groups, `<script>`, `<template>` or `<div>` elements.
definition-list-4.description: When definition lists are not properly marked up, screen readers may produce confusing or inaccurate output. [Learn how to structure definition lists correctly](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/definition-list).

items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  When not empty, element does not have at least one <dt> element followed by at least one <dd> element

link-in-text-block-5.title: Links rely on color to be distinguishable.
link-in-text-block-5.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. Link text that is discernible improves the experience for users with low vision. [Learn how to make links distinguishable](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/link-in-text-block).

items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  The link has insufficient color contrast of 2.35:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #3366cc, surrounding text: #333333)
  The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

link-name-6.title: Links do not have a discernible name
link-name-6.description: Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. [Learn how to make links accessible](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/link-name).

items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  Element is in tab order and does not have accessible text

Fix any of the following:
  Element does not have text that is visible to screen readers
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute

target-size-7.title: Touch targets do not have sufficient size or spacing.
target-size-7.description: Touch targets with sufficient size and spacing help users who may have difficulty targeting small controls to activate the targets. [Learn more about touch targets](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/target-size).

items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Target has insufficient size (214.8px by 17px, should be at least 24px by 24px)
  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 20px instead of at least 24px.

Fix any of the following:
  Target has insufficient size (201.9px by 17px, should be at least 24px by 24px)
  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 20px instead of at least 24px.

table-fake-caption-8.title: Tables do not use `<caption>` instead of cells with the `[colspan]` attribute to indicate a caption.
table-fake-caption-8.description: Screen readers have features to make navigating tables easier. Ensuring that tables use the actual caption element instead of cells with the `[colspan]` attribute may improve the experience for screen reader users. [Learn more about captions](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/table-fake-caption).

items.snippet: <table cellspacing="0" class="nowraplinks collapsible autocollapse" style="width:100%;margin-bottom: 0px; background:transparent; color:inherit;;" id="collapsibleTable0">
items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  The first child of the table should be a caption instead of a table cell
